p: One MR study opposed this evidence, finding that genetically predicted higher systolic blood pressure may decrease Alzheimer’s disease risk ( Østergaard et al., 2015 ). A more recent MR study used SNPs associated with the expression of 12 antihypertensive drug targets and systolic blood pressure ( Walker et al., 2019 ). Only the proxy for angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors was associated with Alzheimer’s disease risk.
